alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Haywood; Jackson; Madison; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 4:28AM EDT until March 25 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Jackson County in western North Carolina... Madison County in western North Carolina... Eastern Swain County in western North Carolina... Haywood County in western North Carolina... Northwestern Buncombe County in western North Carolina... * Until 515 AM EDT. * At 426 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles east of Morristown to 9 miles east of Gatlinburg to 8 miles west of Bryson City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Sylva, Waynesville, Bryson City, Marshall, Cherokee, Canton, Cullowhee, Lake Junaluska, Clyde and Maggie Valley. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
